messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Digest Number 2285 - military
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, I think I got my idea from what s done outside of the US. And I ve heard of people having problems with homeschooling and base commanders. (It
messages.messageBody:
on 8/25/02 11:51 PM, dacunefare@... at dacunefare@... wrote:

> Which has absolutely nothing to do with homeschooling in the states, which
> was the subject about which Joyce opined that the military has it's own
> jurisdiction over the education of dependent children.

Well, I think I got my idea from what's done outside of the US. And I've
heard of people having problems with homeschooling and base commanders. (It
*might* have been outside of the US though.) And I recall someone posting
asking for input for the military on homeschooling policy. And probably more
pieces that I thought all fit together in the same area but were apparently
from different parts of the puzzle.

> I assumed Joyce would know I was being dramatic to tweak her. I shouldn't
> have assumed anything. Oh well.

I did know that :-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 2285 - military
messages.msgSnippet: ***there are some things military homeschoolers should know..... This is a policy memorandum from the DOD Educational Activity about homeschooling. ** Which
messages.messageBody:
***there are some things military homeschoolers should know..... This is a
policy memorandum from the DOD Educational Activity about homeschooling. **

Which has absolutely nothing to do with homeschooling in the states, which
was the subject about which Joyce opined that the military has it's own
jurisdiction over the education of dependent children.

I assumed Joyce would know I was being dramatic to tweak her. I shouldn't
have assumed anything. Oh well.

Deborah - military dependent homeschooling mother of many years, veteran,
glad to be not moving around anymore, anywhere
